review: The item was great, arrived quickly the only weird, weird thing that would have made me send this back had I been in a restaurant was the 2 foot long hair that was wrapped around the remote inside the box. That is not a reflection on the product, this roku feels like the best combination of the chromecast & apple tv all rolled into one (own both). Speed is a bit lacking, but can't complain for $40 (refurb price). The miracast/mirroring functionality isn't all that great, but the channels are good. Not quite as polished as on the Apple TV, start up time for the apps is slow I guess that's because of the CPU/RAM in the stick. I'll probably upgrade to a roku 3 before the end of the year, now that the new one is out. If you're deciding between this and the chromecast, get both. If you're deciding between this and apple tv, unless you want HBO Now, get this. If you're deciding between this and a higher end roku, go higher end, esp if you're paying full price for the roku stick.*updated* Maybe it's because I have the refurb version, but this AM the thing was "stuck" in an app. So I pulled the power and now it's stuck in a bouncing Roku loop. Goes for a bit, reboots, bounces for some more. reboots. Lather rinse repeat. I still love the software, worked great over the weekend for Game of Thrones and being able to use the TWC app on my TV that doesn't have a cable box was great. I think I'll be stepping up to the roku 2 sooner than later.
